metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3933 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An integer overflow could occur when OpenEXR processes a crafted file on systems where size_t < 64 bits. This could cause an invalid bytesPerLine and maxBytesPerLine value, which could lead to problems with application stability or lead to other attack paths.

criterions.comment: ilmbase: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openexr: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
povray: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
